thread.section_title: Theresa May bundled out of Commons by armed police after Parliament terror attack – Metro
thread.title: Theresa May bundled out of Commons by armed police after Parliament terror attack
thread.title_full: Theresa May bundled out of Commons by armed police after Parliament terror attack

author: Nicole Morley
title: Theresa May bundled out of Commons by armed police after Parliament terror attack
text:
A woman ducks under a police tape after an incident on Westminster Bridge in London, March 22, 2017 (Picture: Reuters) British Prime Minister Theresa May is safe after a shooting outside of parliament, her spokesperson confirmed. 
A witness, who did not want to be named, saw Mrs May and her undercover police detail near the area of Parliament where ministerial cars are parked.
Moment MPs were told about the shooting outside Parliament He said there were undercover officers in a 4×4 vehicle in the car park.
‘We just heard gunshots inside Parliament,’ he said. ‘It looked like they are taking her away.’
Theresa May as she speaks during Prime Minister’s Questions (PMQs) in the House of Commons in London on March 22, 2017 (Picture: Getty) The Prime Minister was seen getting into the back of a silver Jaguar before driving off – first apparently heading to Black Rod’s entrance but then turning towards Carriage Gates, near to where the incident took place.
Several injured after gunshots are fired outside Houses of Parliament and car drives into people The spokesman declined to say where May was when the attack took place.
Her security detail were carrying automatic weapons.
Scotland Yard said the attack in Westminster was being treated ‘as a terrorist incident until we know otherwise’.
Police close to the Palace of Westminster, London, after policeman has been stabbed and his apparent attacker shot by officers in a major security incident at the Houses of Parliament (Picture: PA)
